entries.text: Thank you for calling VeloFit customer support. Your call may be recorded for quality assurance. Please describe the reason for your call.
Yeah, I need to return a VeloBand Pulse I bought. It's not working properly, and I want my money back.
Okay, I can help you with that. Can I get your order number or the email address associated with your purchase?
Thank you. One moment while I pull up your order. Okay, I see here you purchased the VeloBand Pulse on October 26th. Today is November 10th.
Yeah, so? It's practically brand new!
I understand, but our return window for the VeloBand Pulse is 10 days from the date of purchase. Unfortunately, you are outside of that window.
Are you kidding me? Ten days? That's ridiculous! It's faulty. I want to return it.

I understand your frustration. While I can't offer a full refund due to being outside of the return window, I can check if a store credit is possible. However, even for store credit, we typically adhere to the 10-day policy.
So you're telling me I'm stuck with this useless piece of tech? This is terrible customer service! I want to speak to a manager!
I understand your frustration. Let me see if there's any possibility of a policy exception in your case. Could you describe the specific issues you're experiencing with the VeloBand Pulse?
It keeps disconnecting from my phone! The heart rate monitor is completely inaccurate. It's just a waste of money! I'm not explaining it again. I WANT A REFUND!

I apologize that you're having these issues. I've reviewed your order and our policy again, and unfortunately, I am unable to process a refund or offer store credit because the purchase falls outside of the 10-day return window. Is there anything else I can assist you with today?
This is unbelievable! I'm never buying anything from you guys again! You can keep your garbage!
I understand your frustration. We value your business and I'm sorry we couldn't resolve this issue to your satisfaction. Have a good day.
